title: Requires travel agents to be registered with the department of state, and provides for the regulation thereof; repealer
summary: Requires travel agents to be registered with the department of state, and provides for the regulation thereof.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         1875

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. JEFFRIES -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Economic Development, Job Creation, Commerce and Industry

       AN  ACT  to  amend the general business law and the economic development
         law, in relation to requiring travel consultants and travel  promoters
         located  or  doing  business  in  this state to be registered with the
         department of state; and to repeal article 10-A of the  general  busi-
         ness law relating to the truth in travel act

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Article 10-A of the general business law is REPEALED and  a
    2  new article 10-A is added to read as follows:
    3                                ARTICLE 10-A
    4                                TRAVEL AGENTS
    5  SECTION 155.   LEGISLATIVE INTENT.
    6          155-A. DEFINITIONS.
    7          156.   DOING BUSINESS WITHOUT REGISTRATION PROHIBITED.
    8          156-A. APPLICATION FOR REGISTRATION.
    9          156-B. CONDITIONS PRECEDENT TO REGISTRATION.
   10          156-C. REGISTRATION.
   11          156-D. GROUNDS FOR DENIAL, SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF REGISTRA-
   12                   TION.
   13          156-E. PREEMPTION.
   14          156-F. REGULATIONS.
   15          157.   TRAVEL AGREEMENTS.
   16          157-A. PROHIBITED PRACTICES BY TRAVEL CONSULTANTS.
   17          157-B. PROHIBITED PRACTICES BY TRAVEL PROMOTERS.
   18          158.   VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES.
   19          159.   SEVERABILITY.
   20    S  155.  LEGISLATIVE INTENT. IT IS HEREBY DETERMINED AND DECLARED THAT
   21  THE PROMOTION OF TRAVEL, EITHER INDIVIDUALLY OR AS A GROUP,  IS  NOW  OF
   22  SUCH  VOLUME  THAT  IT  IS  IN  THE PUBLIC INTEREST TO SUBJECT IT TO THE

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04683-01-1

       A. 1875                             2

    1  REGISTRATION BY AND THE SUPERVISION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF THE  STATE  FOR
    2  THE PURPOSE OF SAFEGUARDING THE PUBLIC AGAINST FRAUD, FALSE ADVERTISING,
    3  MISREPRESENTATION AND SIMILAR ABUSES.
    4    S 155-A. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE:
    5    1. "APPLICANT"  MEANS A TRAVEL AGENT WHO HAS FILED AN APPLICATION WITH
    6  THE DEPARTMENT FOR A REGISTRATION.
    7    2. "DEPARTMENT" MEANS THE DEPARTMENT OF STATE.
    8    3. "DIVISION" MEANS THE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES.
    9    4. "MERCHANT ACCOUNT NUMBER" MEANS AN IDENTIFYING NUMBER  GIVEN  BY  A
   10  CREDIT  CARD  ISSUER  TO  A  MERCHANT  FOR  PURPOSES  OF IDENTIFYING THE
   11  MERCHANT IN THE PROCESSING OF CREDIT CARD CHARGES AND PURCHASES.
   12    5. "PRINCIPAL OWNER" MEANS ANY PERSON CONTROLLING AN INTEREST  GREATER
   13  THAN  TEN PERCENT IN A BUSINESS PROVIDING TRAVEL SERVICES, OR ANY PERSON
   14  WITH A CONTROLLING INTEREST IN A COMPANY THAT HAS A CONTROLLING INTEREST
   15  IN A BUSINESS PROVIDING TRAVEL SERVICES.
   16    6. "REGISTRANT" MEANS A TRAVEL AGENT THAT HAS BEEN ISSUED A  REGISTRA-
   17  TION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE.
   18    7. "SECRETARY" MEANS THE SECRETARY OF STATE.
   19    8. "TIME SHARE" MEANS AN INTEREST IN ANY ARRANGEMENT, PLAN, SCHEME, OR
   20  SIMILAR  DEVICE,  WHETHER  BY  MEMBERSHIP, AGREEMENT, TENANCY IN COMMON,
   21  SALE, LEASE, DEED, RENTAL AGREEMENT, LICENSE, OR RIGHT-TO-USE  AGREEMENT
   22  OR BY ANY OTHER MEANS, WHEREBY THREE OR MORE PURCHASERS, IN EXCHANGE FOR
   23  CONSIDERATION,  RECEIVE  OWNERSHIP  RIGHTS IN OR A RIGHT TO USE THE SAME
   24  ACCOMMODATIONS OR FACILITIES IN REAL PROPERTY, OR  BOTH,  FOR  DIFFERENT
   25  INTERVALS OF LESS THAN A FULL YEAR DURING ANY GIVEN YEAR, BUT NOT NECES-
   26  SARILY FOR CONSECUTIVE YEARS, AND WHICH EXTEND FOR A PERIOD OF MORE THAN
   27  THREE  YEARS  OR  WHICH,  FOR  NOMINAL  CONSIDERATION, MAY BE RENEWED TO
   28  CONTINUE FOR A PERIOD OF MORE THAN THREE YEARS.
   29    9. "TRAVEL AGENT" MEANS  ANY  TRAVEL  PROMOTER  OR  TRAVEL  CONSULTANT
   30  HAVING  A PLACE OF BUSINESS IN THIS STATE OR OFFERING TRAVEL SERVICES TO
   31  ANY PERSON IN THIS STATE.
   32    10. "TRAVEL CONSULTANT" MEANS  ANY  PERSON,  FIRM,  LIMITED  LIABILITY
   33  COMPANY,  CORPORATION,  PARTNERSHIP  OR ASSOCIATION, OTHER THAN A COMMON
   34  CARRIER OR EMPLOYEE OF A COMMON CARRIER,  WHO  AS  PRINCIPAL  OR  AGENT,
   35  SELLS  OR  OFFERS  FOR SALE ANY TRAVEL TICKETS OR ORDERS FOR TRANSPORTA-
   36  TION, OR NEGOTIATES FOR OR HOLDS HIMSELF OR HERSELF OUT BY SOLICITATION,
   37  ADVERTISEMENT  OR  OTHERWISE  AS  ONE  WHO  SELLS,  PROVIDES,  FURNISHES
   38  CONTRACTS  OR ARRANGES FOR SUCH TRAVEL TICKETS OR ORDERS FOR TRANSPORTA-
   39  TION.
   40    FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS ARTICLE, "CARRIER" MEANS  ANY  PERSON,  FIRM,
   41  LIMITED  LIABILITY  COMPANY,  CORPORATION,  PARTNERSHIP  OR  ASSOCIATION
   42  ENGAGED IN THE BUSINESS OF TRANSPORTING PERSONS FOR HIRE.
   43    11. "TRAVEL PROMOTER" MEANS ANY  PERSON,  FIRM,  CORPORATION,  LIMITED
   44  LIABILITY  COMPANY,  PARTNERSHIP  OR  ASSOCIATION,  OTHER  THAN A COMMON
   45  CARRIER OR EMPLOYEE OF A COMMON CARRIER, WHO IS PRIMARILY ENGAGED IN THE
   46  DIRECT SOLICITATION OF PERSONS, BY MAIL OR TELEPHONE, FOR  THE  SALE  OF
   47  ANY TRAVEL OR VACATION INVESTMENTS, GOODS, PRODUCTS OR SERVICES, INCLUD-
   48  ING,  BUT  NOT LIMITED TO TRAVEL OR TOUR BENEFITS, REAL PROPERTY, INTER-
   49  ESTS IN REAL PROPERTY, TIME SHARES, LODGING, COMMODITIES OR  SECURITIES.
   50  FOR PURPOSES OF THIS ARTICLE, A "TRAVEL PROMOTER" DOES NOT INCLUDE:
   51    A. A PERSON, FIRM, CORPORATION, LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY, PARTNERSHIP
   52  OR ASSOCIATION THAT IS AN OFFICIALLY APPOINTED AGENT OF A COMMON CARRIER
   53  AND  MEETS STANDARDS NO LESS THAN THOSE REQUIRED ON JANUARY FIRST, NINE-
   54  TEEN HUNDRED EIGHTY-NINE, FOR AUTHORIZED AGENTS OF THE AIRLINE REPORTING
   55  CORPORATION;

       A. 1875                             3

    1    B. A PERSON, FIRM, CORPORATION, LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY, PARTNERSHIP
    2  OR ASSOCIATION THAT IS A REGISTERED  MEMBER  IN  GOOD  STANDING  OF  THE
    3  CRUISE  LINES  INTERNATIONAL  ASSOCIATION AND WHO SOLELY SOLICITS AND/OR
    4  SELLS TRAVEL SERVICES AND PRODUCTS AS AN OFFICIALLY APPOINTED  AGENT  OF
    5  ONE  OR  MORE  OCEAN  CARRIERS IN THE SALE OF THE OCEAN CARRIER'S TRAVEL
    6  SERVICES PURSUANT TO THE AGENCY APPOINTMENT; OR
    7    C. A BROKER-DEALER REGISTERED WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMIS-
    8  SION OR THE DEPARTMENT OF LAW WHO IS ENGAGED IN THE SALE  OF  SECURITIES
    9  OR  COMMODITIES  OR SALE OR RENTAL OF REAL ESTATE PURSUANT TO ITS REGIS-
   10  TRATION.
   11    12. "TRAVEL SERVICES" MEANS TRANSPORTATION, ACCOMMODATIONS IN LODGINGS
   12  SUCH AS HOTELS, MOTELS OR MOTOR COURTS, RENTAL OF MOTOR VEHICLES, OR ANY
   13  OTHER SERVICE RELATED TO TRAVEL. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS  ARTICLE,  "TRAVEL
   14  SERVICES" SHALL INCLUDE INVESTMENTS IN TIME SHARES.
   15    S 156. DOING BUSINESS WITHOUT REGISTRATION PROHIBITED. NO TRAVEL AGENT
   16  SHALL  OPERATE OR DO BUSINESS IN THIS STATE EXCEPT AS AUTHORIZED BY THIS
   17  ARTICLE AND WITHOUT FIRST BEING REGISTERED BY THE DEPARTMENT.
   18    S 156-A. APPLICATION FOR REGISTRATION. 1. APPLICATION FOR A  REGISTRA-
   19  TION REQUIRED UNDER THIS ARTICLE SHALL BE IN WRITING, UNDER OATH, AND IN
   20  THE FORM PRESCRIBED BY THE SECRETARY, AND SHALL CONTAIN THE FOLLOWING:
   21    A. THE EXACT NAME AND THE ADDRESS OF THE APPLICANT;
   22    B. THE NAME AND THE BUSINESS AND RESIDENTIAL ADDRESS OF EACH PRINCIPAL
   23  AND OFFICER OF THE APPLICANT;
   24    C.  THE  COMPLETE ADDRESS WHERE THE BUSINESS OF THE APPLICANT IS TO BE
   25  CONDUCTED, SHOWING THE STREET AND NUMBER, IF ANY, POST OFFICE AND BUILD-
   26  ING AND ROOM NUMBER, IF ANY, THE OFFICE BUILDING  AND  ROOM  NUMBER,  IF
   27  ANY, AND THE MUNICIPALITY AND COUNTY;
   28    D.  IF  THE APPLICANT HAS ONE OR MORE BRANCHES, SUBSIDIARIES OR AFFIL-
   29  IATES OPERATING IN THE STATE, THE COMPLETE ADDRESS OF EACH SUCH PLACE OF
   30  BUSINESS; AND
   31    E. A COMPLETE SET OF TWO FINGERPRINT CARDS ON A  STANDARD  FINGERPRINT
   32  CARD  APPROVED BY THE DIVISION AND A FEE PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION EIGHT-A
   33  OF SECTION EIGHT HUNDRED THIRTY-SEVEN OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW,  AND  AMEND-
   34  MENTS  THERETO,  FOR  THE  COST OF THE DIVISION'S FULL SEARCH AND RETAIN
   35  PROCEDURES, WHICH FEE SHALL BE REMITTED BY THE DEPARTMENT TO  THE  DIVI-
   36  SION  FOR  DEPOSIT  BY  THE  COMPTROLLER  INTO  THE GENERAL FUND. BEFORE
   37  APPROVING SUCH APPLICATION THE SECRETARY, OR HIS OR HER DESIGNEE,  SHALL
   38  FORWARD  ONE COPY OF SUCH FINGERPRINT CARD AND THE PROCESSING FEE TO THE
   39  DIVISION UPON RECEIPT OF SUCH FINGERPRINTS. THE DIVISION  SHALL  FORWARD
   40  TO THE SECRETARY A REPORT WITH RESPECT TO THE APPLICANT'S PREVIOUS CRIM-
   41  INAL  HISTORY, IF ANY, OR A STATEMENT THAT THE APPLICANT HAS NO PREVIOUS
   42  CRIMINAL HISTORY ACCORDING TO ITS FILES. IF ADDITIONAL COPIES OF FINGER-
   43  PRINTS ARE REQUIRED THE APPLICANT SHALL FURNISH THEM UPON REQUEST.
   44    2. UPON ORIGINAL APPLICATION FOR A REGISTRATION TO OPERATE AS A TRAVEL
   45  AGENT, THE APPLICANT  SHALL  PAY  AN  APPLICATION  FEE  OF  ONE  HUNDRED
   46  DOLLARS.    UPON APPLICATION FOR AN ANNUAL RENEWAL, THE REGISTRANT SHALL
   47  PAY A RENEWAL PROCESSING FEE OF ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS.
   48    S 156-B. CONDITIONS PRECEDENT  TO  REGISTRATION.  UPON  FILING  OF  AN
   49  APPLICATION  FOR  A REGISTRATION, IF THE SECRETARY SHALL BE SATISFIED OF
   50  THE GOOD CHARACTER, COMPETENCY AND INTEGRITY OF THE  APPLICANT,  AND  OF
   51  THE  PRINCIPALS  AND  OFFICERS  THEREOF  ARE  SUCH AS TO COMPLY WITH THE
   52  PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE, HE OR SHE SHALL THEREUPON ISSUE A  REGISTRA-
   53  TION  IN  DUPLICATE  TO OPERATE AS A TRAVEL AGENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE
   54  PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE. THE SECRETARY SHALL  TRANSMIT  ONE  COPY  OF
   55  SUCH  REGISTRATION  TO  THE REGISTRANT AND FILE ANOTHER IN THE OFFICE OF
   56  THE DEPARTMENT. SUCH REGISTRATION SHALL REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND  EFFECT

       A. 1875                             4

    1  FOR  A  PERIOD OF ONE YEAR UNLESS IT IS SURRENDERED BY THE REGISTRANT OR
    2  REVOKED OR SUSPENDED AS PROVIDED IN THIS ARTICLE; IF THE SECRETARY SHALL
    3  NOT SO FIND, THE SECRETARY SHALL NOT ISSUE  SUCH  REGISTRATION  AND  THE
    4  SECRETARY  SHALL  NOTIFY  THE  APPLICANT  OF  THE DENIAL IN WRITING. THE
    5  SECRETARY SHALL APPROVE OR DENY EVERY APPLICATION FOR REGISTRATION WITH-
    6  IN NINETY DAYS FROM THE FILING THEREOF.
    7    S 156-C. REGISTRATION. 1. EACH REGISTRATION ISSUED  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
    8  ARTICLE SHALL STATE THE ADDRESS OR ADDRESSES AT WHICH THE BUSINESS IS TO
    9  BE  CONDUCTED,  STATE  FULLY  THE NAME OF THE REGISTRANT, THE EXPIRATION
   10  DATE OF THE REGISTRATION AND THE UNIQUE REGISTRATION NUMBER ASSIGNED  TO
   11  THE  REGISTRANT. A COPY OF SUCH REGISTRATION SHALL BE PROMINENTLY POSTED
   12  IN EACH PLACE OF BUSINESS OF THE REGISTRANT. SUCH REGISTRATION SHALL NOT
   13  BE TRANSFERABLE OR ASSIGNABLE.
   14    2. EVERY REGISTRANT SHALL INCLUDE IN EVERY  COMMUNICATION,  ADVERTISE-
   15  MENT  AND  CONTRACT  OFFERED  OR  PROVIDED IN THE COURSE OF PROVIDING OR
   16  OFFERING TRAVEL SERVICE, A NOTICE THAT  HE,  SHE  OR  IT  IS  REGISTERED
   17  PURSUANT  TO THIS ARTICLE AND THE NUMBER OF SUCH REGISTRATION. THE FAIL-
   18  URE TO COMPLY WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBDIVISION  SHALL  RESULT  IN
   19  MAKING  THE PROVISIONS OF ANY CONTRACT AFFECTED THEREBY VOIDABLE, AT THE
   20  OPTION OF THE CONSUMER.
   21    3. IN THE EVENT THE LOCATION AT WHICH THE BUSINESS IS TO BE  CONDUCTED
   22  SHALL BE CHANGED, THE REGISTRANT SHALL FORTHWITH NOTIFY THE SECRETARY IN
   23  WRITING,  WHO SHALL THEREUPON, WITHOUT CHARGE ATTACH TO THE REGISTRATION
   24  A RIDER SETTING FORTH SUCH CHANGED LOCATION.
   25    4. IN THE EVENT THAT THERE SHALL BE ANY  CHANGE  IN  THE  REGISTRANT'S
   26  INFORMATION, THE REGISTRANT SHALL NOTIFY THE SECRETARY IN WRITING WITHIN
   27  TEN  BUSINESS  DAYS  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF PARAGRAPH E OF
   28  SUBDIVISION ONE OF SECTION ONE HUNDRED FIFTY-SIX-A OF THIS ARTICLE.
   29    5. A REGISTRATION GRANTED UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE MAY  BE
   30  REVIEWED  BY THE DEPARTMENT UPON APPLICATION THEREFOR BY THE REGISTRANT,
   31  IN SUCH FORM AS THE DEPARTMENT MAY PRESCRIBE, ACCOMPANIED BY THE NON-RE-
   32  FUNDABLE RENEWAL PROCESSING FEE PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION TWO  OF  SECTION
   33  ONE  HUNDRED  FIFTY-SIX-A  OF  THIS ARTICLE. IN NO EVENT WILL RENEWAL BE
   34  GRANTED MORE THAN SIX MONTHS AFTER THE DATE OF EXPIRATION OF A REGISTRA-
   35  TION. NO REGISTRANT SHALL CARRY ON ANY BUSINESS SUBJECT TO THIS  ARTICLE
   36  DURING  ANY  PERIOD  WHICH MAY EXIST BETWEEN THE DATE OF EXPIRATION OF A
   37  REGISTRATION AND THE RENEWAL THEREOF.
   38    6. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL POST AND MAKE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC  ON  ITS
   39  INTERNET  WEBSITE  A  SEARCHABLE LISTING OF ALL TRAVEL AGENTS REGISTERED
   40  PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE AND THEIR CORRESPONDING  REGISTRATION  NUMBERS.
   41  SUCH  LISTING  SHALL  BE  IN BOTH ALPHABETICAL ORDER AND BY COUNTY.  THE
   42  PUBLIC SHALL BE ABLE TO SEARCH THE LISTING BY  REGISTRANT,  COUNTY,  ZIP
   43  CODE  OR  TRAVEL  AGENT REGISTRATION NUMBER.  ALSO, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL
   44  PROVIDE A REAL TIME UPDATE OF SUCH  INFORMATION  TO  THE  DEPARTMENT  OF
   45  ECONOMIC  DEVELOPMENT  FOR  CONSPICUOUS INCLUSION ON THE STATE MARKETING
   46  INTERNET WEBSITE PURSUANT TO  SECTION  ONE  HUNDRED  FIFTY-FOUR  OF  THE
   47  ECONOMIC  DEVELOPMENT  LAW AND FOR DISSEMINATION, UPON REQUEST, AT STATE
   48  TOURISM FACILITIES OPERATED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.
   49    S 156-D. GROUNDS FOR DENIAL, SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF REGISTRATION.
   50  1. THE SECRETARY SHALL HAVE THE POWER TO SUSPEND OR REVOKE  A  REGISTRA-
   51  TION  OR,  IN  LIEU THEREOF, TO IMPOSE A FINE NOT EXCEEDING ONE THOUSAND
   52  DOLLARS PAYABLE TO THE DEPARTMENT, OR REPRIMAND ANY REGISTRANT  OR  DENY
   53  AN APPLICATION FOR A REGISTRATION OR RENEWAL THEREOF UPON PROOF:
   54    A. THAT THE APPLICANT OR REGISTRANT HAS VIOLATED ANY OF THE PROVISIONS
   55  OF THIS ARTICLE OR THE RULES AND REGULATIONS PROMULGATED PURSUANT THERE-
   56  TO;

       A. 1875                             5

    1    B. THAT  THE  APPLICANT  OR  REGISTRANT HAS PRACTICED FRAUD, DECEIT OR
    2  MISREPRESENTATION;
    3    C. THAT  THE  APPLICANT  OR  REGISTRANT  HAS KNOWINGLY MADE A MATERIAL
    4  MISSTATEMENT IN THE APPLICATION FOR OR RENEWAL OF HIS OR  HER  REGISTRA-
    5  TION; OR
    6    D. THAT  THE  APPLICANT OR REGISTRANT HAS DEMONSTRATED INCOMPETENCE OR
    7  UNTRUSTWORTHINESS IN HIS OR HER ACTIONS.
    8    2. NO REGISTRATION SHALL BE REVOKED OR SUSPENDED EXCEPT AFTER  WRITTEN
    9  NOTICE AND A HEARING AS SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISIONS TWO, THREE, FOUR, FIVE
   10  AND SIX OF SECTION SEVENTY-NINE OF THIS CHAPTER.
   11    3. EVERY  REGISTRATION ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE SHALL REMAIN IN
   12  FULL FORCE AND EFFECT FOR A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR  UNLESS  THE  SAME  SHALL
   13  HAVE  BEEN  SURRENDERED,  REVOKED  OR  SUSPENDED  IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE
   14  PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE, BUT THE SECRETARY SHALL  HAVE  AUTHORITY  TO
   15  REINSTATE  A  SUSPENDED REGISTRATION OR TO ISSUE A NEW REGISTRATION TO A
   16  REGISTRANT WHOSE REGISTRATION SHALL HAVE BEEN  REVOKED  IF  NO  FACT  OR
   17  CONDITION THEN EXISTS WHICH WOULD HAVE WARRANTED THE SECRETARY IN REFUS-
   18  ING ORIGINALLY TO ISSUE SUCH REGISTRATION UNDER THIS ARTICLE.
   19    4. WHENEVER  THE  SECRETARY  SHALL  REVOKE  OR  SUSPEND A REGISTRATION
   20  ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS ARTICLE, THE SECRETARY SHALL  FORTHWITH  EXECUTE
   21  IN  DUPLICATE  A  WRITTEN ORDER TO THAT EFFECT. THE SECRETARY SHALL FILE
   22  ONE COPY OF SUCH ORDER IN THE OFFICE OF THE DEPARTMENT AND SHALL  FORTH-
   23  WITH  SERVE  THE  OTHER  COPY UPON THE REGISTRANT. ANY SUCH ORDER MAY BE
   24  REVIEWED IN THE MANNER PROVIDED BY ARTICLE SEVENTY-EIGHT  OF  THE  CIVIL
   25  PRACTICE LAW AND RULES.
   26    S 156-E. PREEMPTION. THE PROVISIONS OF SECTIONS ONE HUNDRED FIFTY-SIX,
   27  ONE   HUNDRED   FIFTY-SIX-A,   ONE   HUNDRED  FIFTY-SIX-B,  ONE  HUNDRED
   28  FIFTY-SIX-C AND ONE HUNDRED FIFTY-SIX-D OF THIS ARTICLE SHALL EXCLUSIVE-
   29  LY GOVERN ALL TRAVEL AGENTS NOTWITHSTANDING THE PROVISIONS OF ANY  OTHER
   30  LAW  TO  THE  CONTRARY, AND FURTHERMORE, NO LOCAL LAW, CODE OR ORDINANCE
   31  SHALL BE ENACTED WHICH SHALL REQUIRE ANY FEE,  LICENSE  OR  REGISTRATION
   32  FOR THE LICENSURE OR REGISTRATION OF TRAVEL AGENTS.
   33    S 156-F. REGULATIONS. THE SECRETARY IS HEREBY AUTHORIZED AND EMPOWERED
   34  TO  MAKE  SUCH RULES AND REGULATIONS NECESSARY FOR THE PROPER CONDUCT OF
   35  THE BUSINESS AUTHORIZED UNDER THIS ARTICLE, AND  NOT  INCONSISTENT  WITH
   36  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ARTICLE.
   37    S  157.  TRAVEL  AGREEMENTS. 1. WHEN A PERSON AGREES, IN RESPONSE TO A
   38  SOLICITATION BY A TRAVEL PROMOTER WHICH IS DIRECTED TO THE PERSON  INDI-
   39  VIDUALLY,  TO  PURCHASE MEMBERSHIP IN A TRAVEL CLUB OR TO ENTER INTO ANY
   40  TRAVEL SERVICES CONTRACT OR OTHER AGREEMENT  TO  ACCEPT  TRANSPORTATION,
   41  LODGING,  AN INTEREST OR INVESTMENT IN A TIME SHARE PLAN, TRAVEL INVEST-
   42  MENTS, OR OTHER TRAVEL SERVICES, THE TRAVEL PROMOTER MUST  PROVIDE  SUCH
   43  PURCHASER  WITH  WRITTEN  DISCLOSURE  OF ALL LIMITATIONS ON AND TERMS OF
   44  SUCH PURCHASE OR AGREEMENT WITHIN FIVE BUSINESS DAYS OF THE DATE OF  THE
   45  AGREEMENT. SUCH DISCLOSURE SHALL CLEARLY AND CONSPICUOUSLY INCLUDE:
   46    A.  THE  NAME,  BUSINESS  ADDRESS  AND  TELEPHONE NUMBER OF THE TRAVEL
   47  PROMOTER;
   48    B. THE AMOUNT DUE, THE DATE OF PAYMENT, THE PURPOSE OF THE PAYMENT AND
   49  AN ITEMIZED STATEMENT OF THE BALANCE DUE, IF ANY;
   50    C. THE NAME  OF  THE  CARRIER  WITH  WHICH  THE  TRAVEL  PROMOTER  HAS
   51  CONTRACTED  TO  PROVIDE THE TRANSPORTATION, THE TYPE AND SIZE OF CARRIER
   52  TO BE USED, AND THE DATE, TIME AND PLACE OF EACH DEPARTURE;
   53    D. A DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF ANY OTHER SERVICES PROVIDED  IN  CONJUNC-
   54  TION WITH THE TRANSPORTATION;

       A. 1875                             6

    1    E. CONDITIONS, IF ANY, UPON WHICH THE TRAVEL SERVICES CONTRACT BETWEEN
    2  THE  TRAVEL  PROMOTER  AND THE TRAVELER MAY BE CANCELLED, AND THE RIGHTS
    3  AND OBLIGATIONS OF ALL PARTIES IN THE EVENT OF SUCH CANCELLATION;
    4    F.  THE  CONDITIONS,  IF  ANY, UPON WHICH THE TRAVEL SERVICES CONTRACT
    5  BETWEEN THE TRAVEL PROMOTER AND THE CARRIER OR  OTHER  SERVICE  PROVIDER
    6  MAY  BE  CANCELLED, AND THE RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS OF ALL PARTIES IN THE
    7  EVENT OF SUCH CANCELLATION; AND
    8    G. A DESCRIPTION OF ALL CONTINGENCIES, LIMITATIONS  AND/OR  CONDITIONS
    9  OF THE AGREEMENT.
   10    2.  AFTER RECEIPT OF FULL WRITTEN DISCLOSURE, THE PURCHASER MAY CANCEL
   11  SUCH AN AGREEMENT UNTIL MIDNIGHT OF THE THIRD  BUSINESS  DAY  AFTER  THE
   12  DISCLOSURE  IS  RECEIVED BY THE PURCHASER, BY USE OF THE FORM PRESCRIBED
   13  IN SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION; HOWEVER,  NOTICE  OF  CANCELLATION
   14  NEED  NOT  TAKE  THE FORM PRESCRIBED AND SHALL BE SUFFICIENT IF IT INDI-
   15  CATES THE INTENTION OF THE BUYER NOT TO BE BOUND.   NOTICE OF  CANCELLA-
   16  TION,  IF GIVEN BY MAIL, SHALL BE DEEMED GIVEN WHEN DEPOSITED IN A MAIL-
   17  BOX, PROPERLY ADDRESSED AND POSTAGE PREPAID.
   18    3. THE WRITTEN DISCLOSURE SHALL INCLUDE, IN ADDITION TO  THE  REQUIRE-
   19  MENTS OF SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION, THE FOLLOWING STATEMENT PRINT-
   20  ED  IN  CAPITAL  AND  LOWER CASE LETTERS OF NOT LESS THAN TEN POINT BOLD
   21  FACED TYPE:

   22          YOU MAY CANCEL THIS TRANSACTION, WITHOUT ANY  PENALTY  OR  OBLI-
   23          GATION,  WITHIN  THREE  BUSINESS  DAYS  FROM THE RECEIPT OF THIS
   24          DISCLOSURE.

   25            TO CANCEL THIS TRANSACTION, MAIL OR DELIVER A SIGNED AND DATED
   26          COPY OF THIS CANCELLATION NOTICE OR ANY OTHER WRITTEN NOTICE  OR
   27          SEND A TELEGRAM TO

   28          (NAME OF SELLER),                 AT (ADDRESS OF SELLER)

   29          ______________________________   ___________________________
   30                                              NOT LATER THAN
   31                                              MIDNIGHT OF THE THIRD DAY
   32                                              AFTER RECEIPT OF THIS
   33          ___________________________         DISCLOSURE
   34          (PLACE OF BUSINESS)

   35          __________________________

   36          __________________________
   37                  (DATE)

   38          I HEREBY CANCEL THIS TRANSACTION

   39          (DATE)
   40                                           ______________________________
   41                                               (PURCHASER'S SIGNATURE)

   42    4.  UNTIL  THE  WRITTEN DISCLOSURE REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS
   43  SECTION HAS BEEN RECEIVED, THE PURCHASER MAY  CANCEL  THE  AGREEMENT  BY
   44  NOTIFYING  THE  TRAVEL PROMOTER IN ANY MANNER AND BY ANY MEANS OF HIS OR
   45  HER INTENTION TO CANCEL.
   46    5. WITHIN TEN DAYS AFTER NOTICE OF CANCELLATION IS GIVEN,  THE  TRAVEL
   47  PROMOTER  SHALL  REFUND  TO THE PURCHASER CONCERNED ANY PAYMENTS MADE BY

       A. 1875                             7

    1  SUCH PURCHASER; SUCH REFUND MAY BE MADE BY REACCREDITING THE PURCHASER'S
    2  ACCOUNT IF A CREDIT CARD, DEBIT CARD OR ELECTRONIC  FUNDS  TRANSFER  WAS
